title.narrative: People at Risk of Statelessness in the Dominican Republic

description.narrative: As part of this project, HAI will reach 300 Group A individuals at risk of statelessness, offering them legal accompaniment to the oficialías so that they may receive their identity documentation. HAI, in close collaboration with UNHCR, undertook a series of activities to improve access to Dominican nationality for potential beneficiaries of law 169-14. Following this successful collaboration, HAI, with the support of local promoters, will provide accompaniment and legal support to those individuals categorized as “Group A” (persons who were born in the DR between 1929 and 2007 to “non-resident” parents, previously possessed some form of Dominican citizenship documentation, but whose jus soli citizenship was retroactively stripped due to Ruling 168-13). This proposed project will also contribute to gathering important data related to the process of re-issuing and delivery of “Group A” documentation which will feed a final informative report.

participating-org.narrative: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
